result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa L Purcell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa L Purcell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melissa L Purcell in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Raymond relates Attorney O'Boyle was previous counsel.  Attorney Raymond will assist for today.
All community service work and assessment requirements have been completed.
State relates agreement fulfilled moves to amend Count 3 to Class A misdemeanor 943.50(1m)(b)(4)(a) - retail theft as Party to Crime.  Court grants.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.
Defendant enters Guilty plea as amended.  Court accepts and finds Guilty.
State relates recommendation.  Attorney Raymond relates recommendation.
Court relates and orders:
Court Costs. 60 Days to pay or may have payment plan.

Defendant Melissa L Purcell in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington(for today).  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Diversion court fee paid. First restitution payment paid today. Restorative justice program discussed. Attorney O'Boyle discussed.

1- Make 2nd restitution payment by 7/1/15.
2- Call Attorney O'Boyle and indicate the need for a referral to the Restorative Justice Program.
3- Complete community service work.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Melissa L Purcell in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Diversion court agreement filed. Meet with Community Service before leaving today. Must pay diversion court fee by May 20, 2015.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Melissa L Purcell in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Information Filed.
Defense waives reading;  Plea of Not Guilty
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

15CF21: Defendant Alexis O Crabtree in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF22: Defendant Matthew R Purcell in court with attorney Scott Schlough. Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF23: Defendant Melissa L Purcell in court with attorney John O'Boyle. Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:46: Investigator Chad Thompson with the Rice Lake Police Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies all Defendants. 9:56: Cross by Attorney O'Boyle. 9:59: Cross by Attorney O'Hara. 10:01: Court questions witness. Court grants State 24 hrs to amend Complaints due to clerical error. Court finds probable cause on all cases and binds over for trial.

Arraignments to be set on all cases by counsel.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must have no contact with the Rice Lake Walmart.
Must be fingerprinted today.

Defendant Mellissa L Purcell in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court amends first name to: Melissa and d/o/b to 8-15-88.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.
